text: A central role for a single <extra_id_0> c-Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding site in a thymic locus control region .
Locus control regions ( LCRs ) are powerful assemblies of cis elements that organize the actions of cell-type - specific trans - acting factors .

A 2.3-kb LCR in the human <extra_id_0> adenosine deaminase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ADA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene first intron , which controls expression in thymocytes , is composed of a 200-bp enhancer domain and extended flanking sequences that facilitate activation from within chromatin .
Prior analyses have demonstrated that the enhancer contains a 28-bp core region and local adjacent augmentative cis elements .
We now show that the core contains a single critical <extra_id_0> c-Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding site .

In both transiently cotransfected human cells and stable chromatin-integrated yeast cells , <extra_id_0> c-Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> strongly transactivated reporter constructs that contained polymerized core sequences .
<extra_id_0> c-Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein was strongly evident in T lymphoblasts in which the enhancer was active and was localized within discrete nuclear structures .

Fetal murine thymus exhibited a striking concordance of endogenous <extra_id_0> c-myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression with that of mouse <extra_id_0> ADA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and human <extra_id_0> ADA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> LCR - directed transgene expression .

Point mutation of the <extra_id_0> c-Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site within the intact 2.3-kb LCR severely attenuated enhancer activity in transfections and LCR activity in transgenic thymocytes .
Within the context of a complex enhancer and LCR , <extra_id_0> c-Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can act as an organizer of thymocyte - specific gene expression via a single binding site .
